problem.tex: Let $\omega$ be a holomorphic one form on $\Sigma_g$ for $g\geq2$. Prove that $\omega$ must vanish somewhere on $\Sigma_g$.

solution.tex: As a consequence of the Hopf Principle, given a meromorphic one-form on a compact Riemann surface, the number of zeroes $Z$ minus the number of poles $P$ of $\omega$ is given by $Z-P=2g-2$, where $g$ is the genus of the surface. Let $\omega$ be a holomorphic one form, which can also be thought of as a meromorphic one form with no poles on a compact Riemann surface $\Sigma_g$. Thus $Z=Z-0=2g-2\geq2$, as $g\geq2$. Thus the number of zeroes of $\omega$ is at least two. That must mean that $\omega$ vanishes somewhere.
